alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Jackson; Ouachita; Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 02 at 7:22PM CST until January 02 at 10:30PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Caldwell Parish in north central Louisiana... East Central Jackson Parish in north central Louisiana... Ouachita Parish in north central Louisiana... Southeastern Union Parish in north central Louisiana... * Until 1030 PM CST. * At 722 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Swartz, Richwood, Sterlington, Pine Grove, Drew, Fondale, Cheniere, Lapine, Millhaven, Luna, Folksville, Bosco, Loch Lomon, Fairbanks and Caderville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
